title: The Purpose of the Varnashrama System in Society | Sri Madhu Pandit Dasa | SB 4.14.18 | 16.07.2024
speaker: HG Madhu Pandit Dasa

segments.key_quote: The state's duty and the citizens' duty are very nicely explained in this verse.
segments.summary: HG Madhu Pandit Dasa reads and explains a verse and purport from Srimad Bhagavatam, emphasizing the importance of Varna and Ashrama for societal harmony and the government's role in ensuring citizens engage in devotional service.
segments.transcript: Om Om Bhagavate Vasudevaya. Reading from Srimad Bhagavatam, Canto 4, Chapter 14, Text 18. Canto 4, Chapter 14, Text 18. Translation: In Perpetual Vaisalaprabhupada Jaya, "The king is supposed to be pious in whose state and cities the general population strictly observes the system of eight social orders of Varna and Ashrama and where all citizens engage in worshipping the Supreme Personality of Godhead by their particular occupation." Purport: "The state's duty and the citizens' duty are very nicely explained in this verse. The activities of the government head or king as well as the activities of the citizens must be so directed that ultimately everyone engages in devotional service to the Supreme Personality of Godhead. The king or the government head is supposed to be representative of the Supreme Personality of Godhead and is therefore supposed to see that things go on nicely and the citizens situated in the scientific social order comprise four Ashramas, four Varnas and four Ashramas. In the Vishnu Purana, it is stated that unless people are educated or situated in the scientific social order comprised of four Varnas, Brahmana, Kshatriya, Vaishya and Shudra, then four Ashramas, Brahmacharya, Grahastha, Vanaprastha and Sannyasa, society can never be considered real human society nor can it make any advancement towards the ultimate goal of human life. It is the duty of the government to see that things go on in terms of Varna and Ashrama. As stated here in Bhagavan Etnapurusha, the Supreme Personality of Godhead Krishna is the Etnapurusha. As stated in Bhagavad Gita, Bhaktaram, Yajna Tapasam, Krishna is the ultimate purpose of all sacrifice. He is also the enjoyer of all sacrifices. Therefore, he is known as Etnapurusha. The word Etnapurusha indicates Lord Vishnu or Lord Krishna or any personality of Godhead in the category of Vishnu Tattva. In perfect human society, people are situated in the orders of Godhead. They follow the orders of Varna and Ashrama and are engaged in worshipping Lord Vishnu by their respective activities. Every citizen engaged in an occupation renders service by the resultant actions of his activities. That is the perfection of life. As stated in Bhagavad Gita, yatah pravrttir bhuthanam ena sarvam idam tatam swakarmanatam abhyarchya siddhim vindati manavah: By worship of the Lord, who is the source of all beings and who is all-pervading, man can, in the performance of his own duty, attain perfection. Thus, the Brahmana Kshatriya Vaishya Shudras must execute their prescribed duties as these duties are stated in the Shastras. In this way, everyone can satisfy the Supreme Personality of Godhead, Vishnu. The king or the government head has to see that the citizens are thus engaged. In other words, the state or the government must not deviate from its duty by declaring that state is a secular state, which has no interest in whether or not the people advance in Varna Ashrama. Today, people engage in government service and people who rule over the citizens have no respect for Varna Ashrama Dharma. They complacently feel that the state is secular. In such a government, no one can be happy. People must follow the Varna Ashrama Dharma and the king must see that they follow it nicely." Thus ends the Bhaktivedanta purport.

segments.key_quote: Varna Ashrama system of social organization of human society is a system of social organization meant for civilized human beings.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the Varna Ashrama system as a foundation for civilized society, highlighting its role in elevating consciousness and the importance of adhering to one's designated division of labor.
segments.transcript: So, the duty of the king and that of the citizens is explained here by the great sages to King Vena. As we have been discussing, Varna Ashrama system of social organization of human society is a system of social organization meant for civilized human beings. A civilized human being by following the Varna Ashrama system, he elevates himself into higher states of consciousness. The Varna Ashrama system becomes more abundant, by nationalizing inbuttocks and nuevos and opportunities. Vendra and Sahaja Yoga promote a realized life under the guidance of Varna Ashrama. Vendra and Sahaja Yoga. This civilization, of course, has collapsed. Our Indian civilization was based on this division of labor among different citizens. And then the king's duty is to see that the system does not break. Everyone stays in his division of labor, Brahmana, Kshatriya, Vaishudhra.

segments.key_quote: Varanashrama system is for civilized human being. Because they are disciplined.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the Ashramas are about lifestyle and that the Varna Ashrama system is for civilized human beings because they are disciplined, and laments the destruction of Vedic civilization and the lack of knowledge about Varna Ashrama even among Hindus.
segments.transcript: So, we have, these are all division of labor: Brahmana, Kshatriya, Vaishya and Shudra. And this Brahmana, Kshatriya, Vaishya, Shudra, as per the system, they should execute their respective duties, staying under a particular lifestyle. So, Ashramas are about lifestyle. So, the entire human society, why we say civilized? Varanashrama system is for civilized human being. Because they are disciplined. They stay within an Ashrama. And they perform their respective duties as per their Varna. So, in this way, society also will be, everybody performs their part. The human society also will be harmonious. So, these Varanashrama principles are all given in our Shastras. In Mahabharata, when Bhishma was lying on the bed of arrows, most of his instructions was on the Varanashrama. But we know all now that a normal human being, even if he is a Hindu, he does not know this at all. He does not know what is Varanashrama. So, our Vedic civilization has been destroyed. As far as goal of life is concerned, there is no difference between an Indian and an American or a European. No connection with Sanatana Dharma.

You have to search it in this. Okay. Here it is. Lord Nikolai addresses the British Parliament on 2nd February, 1835. This is 1835 newspaper cutting. So, what speaks in the British Parliament? "I have traveled across the length and breadth of India. And, I have not seen one person who is a beggar or who is a thief. Such wealth I have seen in this country. Such high moral values. For, if Indians think that all that is foreign and English is good, and greater than their own, they will lose their self-esteem, their entire, their native culture. They will lose their native culture. And, they will become what we want them, a truly dominated nation."
